intro: Tutcheria pahangensis, commonly known as the Pahang tutcheria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
